pages.text:
The Country Club of Ocala was founded in 1994 to provide its Members and their Guests with a gathering place to share their high-quality lifestyle standards. The Team Members are devoted to delivering impeccable service and facilities on their mission to support our Members’ needs and interests. Whether Members choose to play golf on the 18-hole championship Golf Course or lounge by the spacious outdoor Pool with friends, the Country Club of Ocala offers only the best. From first-class golf and tennis, to fitness and dining, there is never a shortage of events and activities for persons of all ages and interests.
The Country Club of Ocala attracts friendly, family-oriented people from all walks of life. Our Members' collective sense of character and Community works in tandem with the Club's exceptional amenities and services to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere you can feel when you walk in the door. We are proud to produce an environment that has proven to spark and foster relationships new and old, professional and personal, that have the potential to withstand the test of time.
SharpSpring Form for Membership Information

Mark Lewis
Sean Hershey
Mark Lewis
Director of Tennis
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
Phone: (352) 237-6644 Ext. 5
Mark, originally from San Saba, Texas, comes to us from Golden Ocala where he held the position of Head Tennis Professional. He was the Director of Tennis for a 24-court facility in Texas, as well as the Director of Tennis at the River Valley Club in New Hampshire for eight years prior to making a move to Ocala.
While in New Hampshire, Mark coached the Hanover boys high school team to a 76-7 record and 1 state championship over 5 seasons. He also served as a college coach in both Kansas and Louisiana. Under his guidance both of Mark's Men's and Women's team were ranked in the top 5 in the country and his Men's #1 doubles team won the National Championship in 2004.
During his time in New Hampshire, Mark won USPTR New Hampshire Pro of the Year and USPTA New England Pro of the Year. He has coached many top juniors over the years with many going on to play at Division 1 and Division 2 colleges. Mark is certified by the USPTA, USPTR and as an Etcheberry Strength and Conditioning coach specific to tennis.
Lesson Rates
Private: 60 Min $70 Member

Membership at The Country Club of Ocala builds and strengthens bonds new and old. From golf, aquatics, and tennis, to fitness or simply an excuse to let the socialite in you shine - we are proud to offer all Members the complete Country Club experience.
Full Family
A Full Family Membership entitles the Member, spouse, and all unmarried children under twenty-three (23) years of age, who are living at home or in college, to the following Club privileges: full Clubhouse, Tennis, Pool, fitness facility, and unlimited golf with no payment of green fees.
Junior Family
A Junior Family Membership is available to those individuals age forty-nine (49) and under, entitling the Member, spouse and all unmarried children under twenty-three (23) years of age, who are living at home or in college, to the same privileges as a full family Member. Junior Family Members must upgrade to Full Family Membership at the time of their fiftieth (50th) birthday.
Corporate
A Corporate Membership has the same privileges and monthly dues as a Full Family Membership. The Membership is issued to in the name of the corporation, firm or group and is then assigned to a single officer, director, or executive for his or her use. This entitles the designee's spouse and all unmarried children under twenty-three (23) years of age, who are living at home or in college, to the privileges of a Full Family Member.
Corporate Associate
A Corporate Associate Membership is only granted as part of a Corporate Membership to business associates of the corporation. There is a limit of seven (7) Associate Memberships per each corporation.
Tennis
A Tennis Membership entitles the Member, spouse and all unmarried children under twenty-three (23) years of age, who are living at home or in college, to the following Club: full Clubhouse, Tennis, Pool, and fitness facility. A Tennis Member may play golf as an unaccompanied Guest once per quarter.
National Membership
A National Membership is designed for those who reside more than 15 miles from the Club. National Members are entitled to the following: full Clubhouse, Tennis, Pool, fitness facility, and unlimited golf with no payment of green fees.
Social
A Social Membership entitles the Member, spouse and all unmarried children under twenty-three (23) years of age, who are living at home or in college, to the following Club: full Clubhouse, Pool, and fitness facility. A Social Member may play golf as an unaccompanied Guest once per quarter.
To learn more about the Country Club of Ocala Memberships and which level is right for you and your family, please call the Membership Director's Office at (352) 237-6644 Ext 8.
Membership Director's Office
(352) 237-6644
Ext. 8
